articles.author: Artorn Pookasook, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel expanded its targets in its war with Hezbollah militants in Lebanon on Monday, killing at least 21 people in an airstrike in the north, health officials said, while millions of Israelis took shelter from projectiles fired back across the border.
articles.title: Israel strikes north Lebanon town, UN expresses concern about peacekeepers

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces tightened their squeeze around Jabalia in the north of the enclave, amid fierce battles with Hamas-led fighters.
articles.title: Israel kills at least 40 in Gaza, tanks deepen raid in the north

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has blown up sections of an inter-Korean road on its side of the heavily militarised border between the two Koreas, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea blows up parts of inter-Korean road on its side of border, Seoul says

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Sakshi Dayal, Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Canada alleged a broader effort to target Indian dissidents in the country.
articles.title: Canada expels top India diplomats, links them to murder of Sikh leader

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's attack on Ukraine's southern city of Mykolaiv killed one person and injured at least 16, the head of the regional military administration said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's attack on Ukraine's Mykolaiv kills one, injures 16, governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and China held "substantive" defence and military talks to bolster ties, Russia's defence minister said on Tuesday, as Moscow and Beijing cement a "no limits" partnership and step up criticism of U.S. efforts to extend its influence in Asia.
articles.title: Russia, China bolster defence ties at 'substantive' talks

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Canada's highest court is set to hear arguments on Tuesday on when a young person can be considered an adult for sentencing purposes.
articles.title: Canadian court to consider when minors can be sentenced as adults

articles.author: Shilpa Jamkhandikar
articles.description: The Congress party urged India’s government to take political parties into confidence.
articles.title: Indian opposition pushes Modi for discussion on worsening Canada ties

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik
articles.description: India and Canada expelled six of each others' diplomats in tit-for-tat moves after Ottawa accused Indian government agents of links to the 2023 murder of a Sikh separatist leader near Vancouver.
articles.title: Explainer: Who is Lawrence Bishnoi, at centre of row between India and Canada?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kyrgyz Prime Minister Akylbek Zhaparov landed in Islamabad on Tuesday to attend a heads-of-government gathering of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO), the Pakistani government said, with the city under tight security lockdown.
articles.title: Leaders arrive in locked-down Islamabad for Shanghai Cooperation gathering
